content: Who was the U.S. President during the Civil War who famously delivered the Gettysburg Address?

That would be Abraham Lincoln. He was the 16th President of the United States and served from March 1861 until his assassination in April 1865. During his presidency, he led the country through the American Civil War and issued the Emancipation Proclamation, which proclaimed the freedom of slaves in Confederate-held territory. The Gettysburg Address, delivered in 1863, is one of his most well-known speeches and is considered a masterpiece of conciseness and eloquence.
